full_text: Screened by NARA, 6/7/2023 RESPONSE TO MOTION (S) Page Three November 27, 1989 Petitioner V. U.S. Immigration & Naturalization Service, 803 F. 2d 804 (5th Cir. 1986). In addition, Matter of Gonzalez, Interim Decision #2536 (BIA October 12, 1976) held that: While the burden to establish alienage to establish deportation proceedings is upon the government, a person born abroad is presumed to be an alien and must go forward with the evidence to establish United States citizenship or a legal right to be in the United States under Section 291 of the Immigration & Nationality Act Absent evidence to negate that presumption, the alien is deemed to be in this country in violation of law and the burden of proof requirements to show deportability by clear, convincing and unequivocal evidence are met. THEREFORE, the respondent's appearance at the November 30, 1989 hearing should be waived, as he is represented by counsel. The instant proceedings should not be terminated. Respectfully submitted, Funlia FORD Lisa Furbee Ford Attorney at Law United States Immigration & Naturalization Service 7880 Biscayne Boulevard Miami, Florida 33138 CERTIFICATE OF SERVICE I HEREBY CERTIFY that a true and correct copy of the foregoing government document was mailed this date, postage prepaid, to counsel for the respondent at the following address: ADALSINDA LOMANGINO Adalsinda Lomangino, P.A. 780 N.W. 42nd Avenue, Suite 509 Miami, Florida 33126 Date Legal Clerk
